case_vignette: A 20-year-old woman presents to the clinic with a circular hypopigmented lesion on her right cheek. The patient stated that she used to have a mole in the same location. Over time she noticed a white area around the mole that enlarged to the current size of the lesion. After a few months she noticed the mole in the center of the lesion had disappeared. On further questioning, she denies any personal or family history of skin cancer. The patient is otherwise healthy and has no other symptoms. The patient is a nonsmoker and does not use any tobacco products. The patient's medical history is unremarkable. The patient's family history is also unremarkable.
